data.title: great food, good atmosphere
data.text: The food is fantastic.  I had a salad with chicken.  The salad was green and fresh and the chicken was tasty.  My husband had a beef chimichanga and wow the seasoning on the beef was so yummy!  It's a little fun and funky little place.

data.title: Satisfaction
data.text: We tried a couple of places on State Street, but they were all packed (Saturday Night).  So we tried out Oscar's instead and we left satisfied. The food was tasty (very good hot salsa).  The chile rilleno was flavorful and the black beans were tasty (a rarity in so many Mexican restaurants).  We left happy and full.

data.title: Horrible, Horrible Food High Prices
data.text: This is a horrible place to eat.  Horrible tasting food, dirty, high prices, and were out of food at 1:30 p.m. in the afternoon.  Sucked big time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Mexican  Food
data.text: We ordered  chicken taquitos and  tacos  with  rice and beans. Two  beers to drink. The food tasted good and the staff were friendly and helpful during our visit. The atmosphere was festive and comfortable. Prices are reasonable for what you get.

data.title: SO GOOD!
data.text: My daughter and I just had lunch here at it was amazing! We are already planning our next visit! We had the deluxe chicken salad and the mini burritos. The Pork chili verde was the best I've ever had.

data.title: Long time neighborhood mexican food gem
data.text: Small, great food at reasonable prices. Parking limited close by. Good service. Mid range noise. Seating at tables, somewhat dark inside.

data.title: To eat or NOT to eat!
data.text: I have been coming to Oscar's for 15 years and fell in love with it .....back then....I kept hearing reviews recently from my friends and family whom have been loyal to this restaurant for longer then I've been going and they said it just isn't the same or now their food gives them stomachaches. In disbelief I had to try it out myself. I always get the chicken salad (watery) or the chilli relleno burrito wet (tastless) needless to say I haven't been since and I feel sad because it was my favorite hole in the wall Mexican restaurant where everyone knew your name and the quality was amazing. I hope they last enough to change or go back to how they were. their food will live on...in my memory!

data.title: Always good Mexican food..
data.text: Family style cooking in a small place is friendly in a great location off of State Street. location. Service is good. Great Salsa!!

data.title: Good option in downtown Redlands
data.text: I come here with my husband and with friends. It is slightly pricey but the chips and salsa are good (salsa slightly hot). I virtually always get the carnitas plate -- always good. Did not like the Albondigas soup. They also have a good stuffed pepper dish. They also have tapas (little dishes) that you can mix and match, which is fun. If you are looking for staple Mexican food (e.g. tacos, burritos), I would not come here -- there are a lot of good and cheaper options out there. This place is more for specialty dishes or breakfast (with papas, or potatoes). They also have a full-service bar if you drink. This is still one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. It's small so it's not so good for large parties.

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text: Oscar's is great Mexican food. The food plates are pretty large even for the mini combos. If you are in Redlands you should check this place out if you like Mexican food.

data.title: Not a hole in the wall for sure! Great place to eat.
data.text: I go to Oscars at least once a week. They have the best Homemade salsa in Redlands and they have a great daily special. I always get the many tostada or the tacos on taco Tuesday.

data.title: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in town
data.text:
Incredible food and incredible customer service alike. This little hidden gem will be sure to give your taste buds a rise. 

Unlike many Mexican restaurants, this place offers vegetarian beans free of lard, but that also taste amazing.

Definitely one of the best places you can eat.

data.title: I want to give more stars!
data.text: Oscars is an institution in Redlands. We all wanted it to be the way it was back in the 80s. It looks the same and the service is still top notch, it's just not what it  once was. Don't fix what ain't broken. This is not a place for a healthy meal; this is a place you go to indulge. The food is still good and I would still recommend it, but it's not the Oscars of the 70s and 80s.  I guess nothing stays the same.

data.title: Friendly Staff and Good Food
data.text: This small place is great for informal dining, and a quick bite.  I think that if I lived in Redlands that I might become a regular.

data.title: A Mistake to Go Back
data.text:
Oscar's was taken off my lunch list years ago. But recently, I was at a meeting where a person who'd grown up here was visiting and mentioned he had cravings for Oscar's and was going to visit after the meeting. His mention of Oscar's got me thinking about it and I decided to go back and give it another try.

I went with my wife for lunch. I looked at the prices on the menu and was amazed as I looked around how many people were in there. The prices are very high. We got our food, I don't even recall the specifics, I got some kind of a combination plate, which included a fish taco, and both of us ended up leaving much of it uneaten. I usually do everything but lick the plate, so this is not a common event for me. It was not tasty, it had little flavor, and I'd paid much more for it than I would normally spend at a Mexican restaurant. We were anxious to leave and I couldn't flag our waitress, so I stood up and went to the front to pay the bill. 

Oscar's is off my lunch list again and I am committed to not going back.

data.title: Ok for first time
data.text: My husband was recommended by his brother to try Oscar's. We finally managed a visit yesterday and found it average. Although it is very difficult to find authentic delicious mexican food, Oscar's wasn't so bad. The salsa was good and the chips warm. Mexican restaurants MUST have delicious salsa or there is no point in continuing (Casa Maya ugh!) We both had a ranchero burrito. The sauce was OK and the rice and beans were good. My husband tried the papas wich tasted a bit bland. Our check was reasonable but I can see how it can get pricey for the quality of the food. It's a small neat place that I'm sure at one point was the place to eat. Maybe we will try it again.

data.title: Just OK...
data.text: Nothing terrible about this place, it's conveniently located, the service is friendly and fast, and it's open all day so you can grab a late lunch or early dinner, but the food is pretty standard low end Mexican, and if you need a drink, probably stick with a beer because the margarita was, by my standards kinda awful.

data.title: great mother's day
data.text: on a recommendation, we checked out Oscars.  great choice, very tender meats, great meal all around, and lots to eat.  when teh salsa is great, you know the rest is great too.  no filler in burrito-yay!  some of hte most tender meat I have eaten.  great service, interesting atmosphere.  right down town.  will eat there again.

data.title: Open all day, Great food and prices.
data.text: I have been going to Oscars for breakfast for some time and find the staff very profesional and they treat you like family.  They have a full bar and a mexican and american fair menu. I have alway had very good tasting food. The chili Verde is the best around (just enough HEAT)

data.title: Landmark restaurant but maybe seen better days
data.text: Took my elderly father here.  Hadn't been here in 25 or more years.  He is typically easy to please but didn't care for the chile verde.  I had a chimichanga which was average.  Oscars is located downtown so can be convenient but there are likely better options. Service was decent and prices didn't seem out of line as highlighted by others.
